definition: enough (sufficient)/enough (too much)/(coll.) (before adj.) really/(coll.) to reach by stretching out
square/frame/rule/(legal) case/style/character/standard/pattern/(grammar) case/(classical) to obstruct/to hinder/(classical) to arrive/to come/(classical) to investigate/to study exhaustively

sentences.english: These people are not worthy of this inheritance.
sentences.chinese: 这些人不够格担任这个产业。

sentences.english: Her youth disqualifies her from becoming president.
sentences.chinese: 她年纪轻，当校长还不够格。

sentences.english: I do not think he is qualified .
I'm not sure if he is qualified enough to be our representative.
sentences.chinese: 我不确定他是否够格做我们的代表。

sentences.english: Aren't our translation standards good enough?
sentences.chinese: 难道我们的翻译水准还不够格吗？

sentences.english: Five seven, well ok five six and a half is not enough to teach happiness?
sentences.chinese: 米70。。。是1米69不够格传授快乐吗？

sentences.english: But as far as doting wife goes, I think I lack form.
sentences.chinese: 但是作为一个受宠的妻子，我觉得我做得不够格。

definition: well qualified/competent/to be equal to the task/able to do sth very well
qualified/competent (professionally)/to be up to a task
to be on an equal footing
to regard as/to figure/to calculate/to compute
top-notch (colloquial)/to push oneself to the front
acceptable/passable/justifiable/(of a course of action) to make sense
